frameDefinitions: An intentional Agent or a causing event (Cause) event causes a Theme which is already in motion to take a different Path or Direction, or reach a different Goal than the Original_path.
A Person is in a state of prosperity and/or renown after some period of development or hardship in an Endeavor.
A Competition comes to an end, with a Competitor tying, winning, or losing against an Opponent (or opponents) according to their Score.
A Competitor claims a Prize as a result of the outcome of their participation in a Competition.

This frame is concerned with the idea that people (Participant_1, Participant_2, or Participants) participate in an organized, rule-governed activity (the Competition) in order to achieve some advantageous outcome (often the Prize).
A Self_mover intentionally moves in a Directionon a Path relative to landmark that is neither the Source nor the Goal of the overall motion.
frameExamples:
The hotel business didn't last - especially after the construction of a railroad
<t>diverted</t> travelers a few miles west to what is now the village of Eagle
Unbelievable--he <t>lost</t> the gold medal by just .02 points!
We <t>won</t> a car in the raffle.
Ambrose Powell <t>forded</t> over on one horse, and we drove the others after him.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity that is in motion, and changes path due to the action of an Agent or due to a Cause.

The route that the <fen>Theme</fen> was originally headed for.  In cases when the <fen>Theme</fen> is an intentional actor or is controlled by an intentional actor, the <fen>Original_path</fen> correlates with the (former) plan of the actor.  In other cases, the <fen>Original_path</fen> corresponds to what would be expected for the path of the <fen>Theme</fen> from general principles or physics.  (In some cases, the <fen>Original_path</fen> may indicate the intended destination, and not just the path, of the <fen>Theme</fen>.)
The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up travelling after being diverted.
The location the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up in after being redirected.

This role is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the current deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that does not necessarily correspond to the <fen>Goal</fen>.  Often <fen>Direction</fen> is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the <fen>Theme</fen>, the orientation imposed by an implicit observer, or the inherent orientation of the scene.
An individual that determines the change in course of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
An event that brings about the change in the <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the redirection of motion occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location at which the redirection occurs.
A sentient being or group of beings that is prosperous or well known after being involved in some <fen>Endeavor</fen>.
An event that the <fen>Person</fen> is involved in which leads to their state of prosperity or renown.
The time when the <fen>Entity</fen> is determined to be successful.
The individual involved in the <fen>Competition</fen>.
The individual that the <fen>Competitor</fen> has been competing against.
The individuals who compete against each other.
The event in which the <fen>Competitors</fen> compete with each other.
The time at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
The location at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
The individual or individuals involved in the <fen>Competition</fen>.
A socially and/or monetarily significant entity which is given to a <fen>Competitor</fen> according to <fen>Score</fen> or <fen>Rank</fen>.
When the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
The location where the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
This role identifies the first (or only) participant in a competition.
This role identifies the second participant in a competition.
This role is used for plural NP participants in a competition.
This role is used for the name of the competition.
The period of time when the <fen>Competition</fen> occurs.

Where the event takes place. 
A constituent tagged as <fen>Place</fen> may require annotation on a secondary FE-layer.
This is a sentient being or a vehicle steered by a sentient being which moves.
Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>.
Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>, excluding directional expressions:
Any expression which indicates where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element <fen>Goal</fen>.
The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, taken simultaneously.
The direction in which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> goes.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
listRoleExamples: VTA detoured motorists <fex>from southbound I-880</fex> onto Airport Boulevard to access Coleman Avenue.
Traffic was redirected Tuesday <fex>along Melrose Avenue</fex> to make way for the scoreboard columns, Mellecker said.
Not knowing any better, he redirected people <fex>to the city center</fex>.
Flight 93 left Newark, NJ, earlier that day, bound for San Francisco, but it was hijacked by four terrorists who diverted it <fex>back toward Washington, DC</fex> .
When we ended up over in Marrakech, or Dakar, <fex>they</fex> diverted us up to Tobruk.

We even got a bonus morning in Tokyo's international airport when <fex>a bad storm</fex>
diverted us on the way to Asia.
<fex>Last Tuesday</fex> they were detouring everybody down onto 5th avenue .
They redirected us <fex name=''>at the corner of Alstone and Bokchoy Avenue</fex>.
<fex>He</fex> became a success at the age of 25.
Looking back, I had a very successful <fex>career</fex>.
After 20 years of hard work, he finally made it as an artist <fex>in '84</fex>.
<fex>Jo</fex> played the lottery every day.
Jo played <fex>Leslie</fex> at tennis.
<fex>Jo and Leslie</fex> played tennis.
Jo played <fex>in the foosball tournament</fex>
First layer: John's first competition <fex>at Wimbledon</fex> astonished the crowd.
<fex>We</fex> drive down dusty roads, forded through a stream, and tried to get up a mountainside on a rocky road.
We forded <fex>from the island</fex> to the mainland.
We decided to cut <fex>through the forest</fex>.
I'll cut across the Sahara desert <fex>up to Algeria and Morocco</fex>.
We followed the trail (which is well marked with cairns) and then cut <fex>west</fex> across a grassy meadow for about 1000 feet to the crest of  the nearby saddle lying below North Peak.
The Federal Army of the Potomac forded the river <fex>in August 1862</fex>.
The common brook is best forded <fex>south of the hut</fex>.
